intro: Cremanthodium prattii, commonly known as the Sierra primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10 to 20 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy, with showy yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Cremanthodium prattii is part of the Primulaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures.
